ygData.subject: Re: Last names?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Just like selling bone chips to necros, and so on... ... Hear, hear. My most enjoyable RP moments come when, in the course of my travels, I encounter a
ygData.messageBody:
>I personally find it interesting. Free enterprise at work.

Just like selling bone chips to necros, and so on...

>I am a cleric and I gladly heal for free. And undying loyalty
>is greatly appreciated as well :) It's part of the reason I
>chose to be a cleric. You always have a friend.

Hear, hear. My most enjoyable RP moments come when, in the course of
my travels, I encounter a party of PCs resting after a terrible
battle. I stop to heal and bless each of them, discussing their
recent fortunes (or misfortunes) as I do so and as I meditate
afterwards. Invariably, I leave with new names in my friends list,
and having been blessed myself by their gratitude and vows of future
aid in my time of need. That type of experience is the distillation
of why this is the only class for me.

>However, I've encountered players who seem to think
>that's all I do, or that I somehow *owe* them. I'll be kneedeep
>in gnolls in black burrow, mana half gone, in a party, and get a
>tell "Can you heal me?"

Hmm, I've never had someone "demand" healing from me. I'm not even
sure how I'd react to it. Most people are actually surprised that
another player would take time to stop and assist them without any
apparent motivation for personal gain- only a very few seem to
believe themselves entitled to that aid. And I can easily disenchant
them of that notion...

>When I finally meet up with the individual all they need is to be
>"topped off" hp-wise. <grrr> It's repeat cases with individuals
>like these that I'll ask for donations :)

Or claim to be out of mana, or type /ignore, or...

>As long as they aren't screwing other people in the process,
>I feel that if people have a service other people want, I think
>its their perogative to charge for it.

Or not to charge, as the case may be. I'm 10th level as well, still
trying to decide what I'm going to do with my ability to bind at
level 14. I can easily see myself declaring open season for 15
minutes, binding all comers, asking only that they repay me by
assisting others characters they encounter who may be in need. I can
also easily see myself charging everyone 5g to bind and buying a big
fat chainmail helmet with the proceeds...=-)

Walbort, Cleric of Brell Sirilis
Bristlebane Server
